definition: nodding acquaintance

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: I have only a bowing [nodding] acquaintance with him.
I have a nodding acquaintance with him.
A woman who can't forgive should never have more than a nodding acquaintance with a man.
sentences.chinese: 不懂寬恕的婦人永遠只能是男人的點頭之交。

sentences.english: In consequence, their acquaintance developed into long and profitable friendship.
sentences.chinese: 他們由點頭之交變成了長期互利的朋友關係。

sentences.english: Oh, I have been very fortunate, " he said, nodding".
sentences.chinese: 他是點頭之交，我連他的名字都不知道。

sentences.english: He is only a nodded acquaintance of mine.
I can't say I know him well, but we have a nodding acquaintance.
sentences.chinese: 我不能說我和他很熟，不過我們有點頭之交。
我與他僅僅是點頭之交。

sentences.english: Again, he is a nodding acquaintance, i don't even know his name.
sentences.chinese: 他是點頭之交，我連他的名字都不知道。

sentences.english: John has been a nodding acquaintance of mine for the last seven years.
sentences.chinese: 過去七年，我跟約翰只是點頭之交。

sentences.english: Are we on speaking terms, or do we just nod occasionally?
sentences.chinese: 我們關係密切，還是隻是點頭之交？

sentences.english: I am on nodding terms with him.
Oh, I have been very fortunate, " he said, nodding to himself."
sentences.chinese: 他是點頭之交，我連他的名字都不知道。
